column2: 1. If a driver follows you too closely, you should:
column8: move to another lane if possible.

column2: 2. With a Class C Driver’s License you may:
column4: operate vehicles with a gross vehicle weight rating of less than 26,001 pounds.
column6: operate vehicles with a gross vehicle weight rating of more than 26,001 pounds.
column8: operate any motor vehicle, regardless of size or weight.

column2: 5. Which signs have black letters on a yellow or orange background?

column6: A road joins from the right
column8: There is a series of sharp turns up ahead on the road

column2: 7. If the entrance lane is too short to allow acceleration to highway speed, you should:
column4: merge into highway traffic as soon as possible.
column6: stop and wait for a large gap in traffic, then enter the highway and accelerate quickly.
column8: go to the next entrance ramp.

column2: 8. You are stopped at a stop sign and you are going to go straight through the intersection. A car on the cross road has stopped at a stop sign on your right and is going to go straight. Who has the right-of-way?
9. Before entering a curve, you should:

column4: warns drivers of a sharp turn left. Drivers should slow their speed and keep to the left.
column6: provides an advance notice of a roundabout.
column8: warns drivers that U-turns are not permitted.

column2: 12. This road sign warns drivers that:
column4: the road surface ahead changes to a low-type surface or earth road.
column6: vehicles must leave the pavement immediately.
column8: the dirt on the side of the road is soft.

column2: 13. The yield sign is ___ and white, with ___ letters.
15. What is the meaning of blue traffic signs?
column8: A blue background indicates a regulatory sign.

column6: Right turn on red light permitted

column4: according to weather and road conditions.

If the way is clear, you may move forward slowly without stopping.

column2: 22. When approaching an intersection with a traffic control signal that is not working, drivers should:
column4: stop as you would if there were stop signs in all directions, yield the right-of-way, then enter the intersection.
column6: speed up and proceed through the intersection.
column8: try not to stop if the intersection is clear.

column2: 23. While driving, you see a flooded roadway ahead. You should:
column4: stop your vehicle on the roadway.
column6: proceed through the flooded area with caution.
column8: turn around and find another route to get to your destination.

column2: 24. If you meet a stopped school bus with the lights flashing and the signal arm extended, you should:
column6: watch for children and proceed at normal speed.
column8: proceed at 15 MPH or less, if no children are present.

column2: 25. If you get on a wrong expressway exit, you must:
column4: use the the exit ramp to accelerate to expressway speed and blend with traffic.
column6: get off at the next exit and look for signs that tell you how to return to the expressway.
column8: drive in reverse to return to the expressway.

column2: 26. Which of the following must you obey over the others?

column4: they must wait for the traffic signal to turn green before turning right or left.
column6: they may not turn right or left during the red light.
does not increase the chance of a crash.

column2: 29. Unlike passenger cars, trucks have blind spots:

column4: a dip in the road. Drivers should be ready to stop if the dip is filled with water.
column6: a bridge ahead, wide enough to accommodate two lanes of traffic, but with very little clearance.
how much time passes between drinks.

column2: 32. Vehicles stopped behind a school bus when the red lights are flashing must remain stopped until:
column4: all students are off the bus.
column6: the stop arm is retracted and the bus begins moving.

column2: 33. When dust is blowing across the roadway making it difficult to see other vehicles, you should drive slower and turn on your:

column4: when it first starts to rain.

column2: 36. When turning left at an intersection:
column4: you should never yield to oncoming traffic and pedestrians.
column6: you should always yield to oncoming traffic and pedestrians.
column8: oncoming traffic and pedestrians should yield to you.

column4: remain to the right when they prepare for a left turn.
column6: remain near the left edge of the road.
column8: ride in a bicycle lane, if available.

column2: 38. When you cannot see any farther than 100 feet ahead due to rain, snow, smoke, fog or blowing dust, you cannot safely drive faster than:

column4: an area designated for blind persons.
column6: the area where pedestrians may cross the road.

column2: 40. To see vehicles in your blind spots, you must look:
